article.title: Efficiency of thermal relaxation by radiative processes in protoplanetary discs: constraints on hydrodynamic turbulence

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula **t<sub>emit</sub> = Cv / (16 max[κ<sub>d</sub><sup>P</sup>, κ<sub>g</sub><sup>P</sup>] σT<sup>3</sup>)**  represent?
choices: The optically thick relaxation timescale.
The collisional timescale between dust and gas.
The thermal emission timescale in the optically thin regime.
The sound crossing time over one pressure scale height.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula **t<sub>d/g</sub><sup>relax</sup> = max[t<sub>d/g</sub><sup>emit</sup>, t<sub>d/g</sub><sup>coll</sup>]** describe?
choices: The total thermal energy of dust and gas in a protoplanetary disc.
The minimum time required for dust or gas to achieve local thermodynamic equilibrium.
The characteristic relaxation timescale for dust or gas in the optically thin regime.
The ratio of thermal energy between dust and gas in the optically thin regime.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula **Σ<sub>c</sub> = (2 − p) M<sub>disc</sub> / (2πR<sub>c</sub><sup>2</sup>)** define?
choices: The surface density profile of the disc.
The total mass of the disc.
The surface density at the cut-off radius.
The volumetric density of the disc.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dashed line in Fig. 1 represent?
choices: The temperature power law profile.
The volumetric density through the midplane.
The surface density profile.
The pressure scale height.

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the solid lines in Fig. 2a and 2c represent?
choices: Dust opacity only.
Gas opacity only.
Combined dust and gas opacity.
Rosseland mean opacities.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the formula **τ<sub>R,λ/2</sub> = ∫<sub>-λ/4</sub><sup>+λ/4</sup> κ<sub>R</sub>ρ dl** represent?
choices: The diffusion length scale.
The Rosseland optical depth over a region of the same sign of the perturbation amplitude.
The spatial average of the Rosseland opacity over λ.
The local thermal emission timescale.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Fig. 3, what does the light grey shading represent?
choices: Regions of dust collisional decoupling.
Regions of gas collisional decoupling.
The fastest radiative relaxation via thermal emission.
Optically thick relaxation.
